A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: You know it's bad when Mark-fricking-Hamill himself hates the film or at least the way Luke is presented in this film\, as for the rest of this film... I am short for words and not in a good way\, I can't believe I am saying this but I wish JJ Abrams directed and wrote this one as well. At least then we would have gotten a film with a cohesive story which picked up on the story threads left in TFA instead of unnecessarily killing of the film's potential and reviving pointless characters only to do the same thing all over again. I can't wait for Episode IX the same way that I couldn't wait for Episode III since once again finally - it's time for the saga to end.
